overview: From 2025-06-08 to 2025-06-15, elizaos/eliza had 4 new PRs (5 merged), 2 new issues, and 7 active contributors.

topIssues.title: LOG_LEVEL from .env Not Working in 1.0.6
topIssues.author: harperaa
topIssues.body:
Bug Report: thanks to claude code....

  Issue Summary

  LOG_LEVEL set in .env files is ignored, but works when
  set via command line environment variables.

  Root Cause

  Timing/Order of Operations Problem: The core logger is
  initialized during module import (before .env loading)
  and never rechecks environment variables.

  Technical Details

  Problem Code Locations:

  1. Early Logger Initialization
  (packages/core/src/logger.ts):
  // Lines 148-152 - Logger configured at module import 
  time
  const isDebugMode = (process?.env?.LOG_LEVEL ||
  '').toLowerCase() === 'debug';
  const effectiveLogLevel = isDebugMode ? 'debug' :
  process?.env?.DEFAULT_LOG_LEVEL || 'info';

  2. Late .env Loading
  (packages/cli/src/commands/start.ts):
  // Lines 334-380 - .env loaded much later in start 
  command
  const loadEnvConfig = () => {
    // ... .env file processing happens here
  }

  Problematic Sequence:

  1. Node.js starts → CLI imports modules
  2. logger.ts imported → reads process.env.LOG_LEVEL 
  (empty) → configures 'info' level
  3. Much later: start command executes
  4. Much later: .env file loaded → LOG_LEVEL set in
  process.env
  5. Logger already configured, never rechecks LOG_LEVEL

  Why Command Line Works:

  Command line env vars are set before Node.js starts, so
  they're available during early logger initialization.

  Evidence

  - ✅ Command line: LOG_LEVEL=debug elizaos start → Debug
   logs appear
  - ❌ .env file: LOG_LEVEL=debug → Debug logs don't
  appear
  - ❌ Runtime check: Logger configuration is static after
   module import

  Code Snippets

  Logger reads LOG_LEVEL too early:
  // packages/core/src/logger.ts:151-152
  const isDebugMode = (process?.env?.LOG_LEVEL ||
  '').toLowerCase() === 'debug';
  const effectiveLogLevel = isDebugMode ? 'debug' :
  process?.env?.DEFAULT_LOG_LEVEL || 'info';

  But .env loading happens later:
  // packages/cli/src/commands/start.ts:334-380  
  const loadEnvConfig = () => {
    // Environment loading happens in start command, after
   logger init
  }

  Proposed Fix

  Make logger initialization lazy/dynamic - defer
  LOG_LEVEL reading until after .env files are loaded, or
  add a mechanism to reconfigure logger when environment
  changes.

  This is a clear architectural issue where static module
  initialization happens before dynamic environment
  loading.

topIssues.title: Knowledge management (RAG) not working (implemented) in 1.0.6
topIssues.author: harperaa
topIssues.body:
**Describe the bug**

I am trying to get rag working and following docs, but that code is not implemented in 1.0.6.  It appears to be commented as a placeholder in 
 
**To Reproduce**

settings: {
    secrets: {},
    ragKnowledge: true,
  },
  knowledge: [
    {
      directory: 'knowledge/foobar',
      shared: true,
    },
  ],

**Expected behavior**

I expect that it would parse on startup and it was not doing that, as it used to do.  So, I looked into code and found this... summary from claude....

Missing Implementation Locations

  1. AgentRuntime Initialization Missing Knowledge 
  Processing

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 494-651)
  - The AgentRuntime.initialize() method should process
  character.knowledge but doesn't
  - No call to any knowledge processing function during
  agent startup

  2. TODO Comment Confirms Missing Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/specs/v1/index.ts (line 50)
  // TODO: Implement the remaining adapters: ... - 
  knowledge / memory
  This is a developer comment explicitly stating that
  knowledge processing is not implemented yet.

  3. Bootstrap Plugin Missing KNOWLEDGE Provider

  File: /packages/plugin-bootstrap/src/providers/index.ts
  - Multiple message examples reference providers: 
  ['KNOWLEDGE'] in character files
  - But the bootstrap plugin doesn't export any KNOWLEDGE 
  provider
  - Provider list is incomplete - missing the knowledge
  provider entirely

  4. RagService Interface Exists But No Implementation

  File: /packages/core/src/runtime.ts (lines 52-61)
  interface RagServiceDelegator extends Service {
    getKnowledge(message: Memory, scope?: { roomId?: UUID;
   worldId?: UUID; entityId?: UUID }):
  Promise<KnowledgeItem[]>;
    _internalAddKnowledge(item: KnowledgeItem, options?:
  any, scope?: any): Promise<void>;
  }
  The interface exists but no actual implementation of
  this service.

  5. Missing Functions

  - processCharacterKnowledge() - Referenced in docs but
  doesn't exist anywhere
  - No knowledge file reading/processing logic
  - No connection between character.knowledge array and
  embedding system

  Developer Comments Confirming This

  The codebase has explicit TODO comments indicating that
  knowledge/memory functionality is intentionally 
  unfinished. The character examples even reference
   a KNOWLEDGE provider that doesn't exist, suggesting
  this was planned but never implemented.

topPRs.title: feat: Split types.ts into granular files
topPRs.author: lalalune
topPRs.body:
This PR splits the gigantic types.ts into logical and granular sections

Nice for agentic search etc

topPRs.title: feat: add lockfile cleanup for GitHub fallback installations
topPRs.author: wtfsayo
topPRs.body:
## Summary
- Adds automatic lockfile cleanup when falling back to GitHub installations
- Prevents circular dependency issues during npm-to-GitHub fallback scenarios

## Changes
- **New `removeFromBunLock()` function**: Safely removes package entries from bun.lock using `bun remove`
- **New `executeInstallationWithFallback()` function**: Handles npm installation with automatic GitHub fallback and lockfile cleanup
- **Updated `installPlugin()` function**: Uses the new fallback mechanism for registry-based installations

## How it works
1. Attempts npm installation first
2. If npm fails and GitHub fallback is available:
   - Calls `removeFromBunLock()` to clean up any partial lockfile entries
   - Attempts GitHub installation with clean lockfile
3. Prevents circular dependency errors that can occur with stale lockfile entries

## Test plan
- [ ] Test npm installation success (should work as before)
- [ ] Test npm installation failure with GitHub fallback available
- [ ] Verify lockfile cleanup occurs before GitHub installation
- [ ] Test with and without existing bun.lock file
- [ ] Verify no regression in existing installation flows

topPRs.title: fix(logs): resolve empty logs display with existing data
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body: Fixes logs viewer incorrectly showing empty state when data is present.

topPRs.title: feat: exclude text embedding from view
topPRs.author: 0xbbjoker
topPRs.body: Filters out text embedding content from debug logs to reduce noise and improve log readability.
